title: What's a much better sentence than 'He does things'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Context is everything. In the right context, that is actually a GREAT sentence. For example, let´s imagine a dialogue in a mafia movie. You are an undercover agent, posing as an envoy for a mafia boss from another city, and you to a meeting with the big shots. “Nice meeting you, Mr. Scavullo. This is Luca, my assistant, and this is Joe. He does things.” Hmm, you wonder, what kind of “things” does Joe do, and will he do them to me if they find out I’m a cop.

Oh man, while that’s a grammatically correct sentence, just about anything is better than it. “He does things” is so vague. A reader such as myself has no idea what you’re referring to. Who is he? What things is he doing? The biggest thing to change is to clarify what he is doing. “He is doing the dishes” or “he is running” are both much clearer. If you simply mean he is in a state where he is doing a lot of things or is occupied, then you could say “He is busy.” Best wishes!
